com.oop.calculator

Class Calculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • com.oop.calculator.Calculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Calculator
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Author: Evin Darling (C00144257) Date: March 2017 Description: A calculator application using Graphical User Interface components. Features: User input via buttons. Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division, Modulo, Square, Power, negate number, decimal numbers, parenthesis, memory functions.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Calculator()

    • Method Detail

      • addComponentsToPane

        private void addComponentsToPane(java.awt.Container pane)
        This method will set up the GUI of the calculator. Sets layout manager to GridBagLayout. Adds screen to a JScrollPane with conditional horizontal scrolling. Adds the JScrollPane to content pane. Uses nested for loops to create and add all button components.
        Parameters:
        pane - - The content pane passed in by constructor

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This method handles the specific functionality of each of the GUI buttons on the calculator based one what button was pressed. Checks if the source of the ActionEvent that fired is from one of the buttons in the buttons array, then executes relevant block of code to perform that function.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - - The ActionEvent

      • updateScreen

        private void updateScreen()
        Updates the screen by setting the text to textLine1 and textLine2 separated by a new line.

      • buildInfixAndModifyScreen

        public void buildInfixAndModifyScreen(java.lang.String operator)
        This method is used to build a queue containing all elements of the expression the user wished to evaluate, in the standard infix format. This will later be converted to postfix format. It then modifies the screen to display the expression as the user inputs operands and operators.
        Parameters:
        operator - - the user inputted operator or parenthesis

      • infixToPostfix

        public void infixToPostfix()
        This method converts the infix expression that is stored in the infix queue into a postfix expression (Reverse Polish Notation using Dijkstra's Shunting-yard Algorithm and stores it in the postfix queue.

      • evaluateExpression

        public void evaluateExpression()
        This method implements an algorithm to evaluate an expression in Reverse Polish Notation.

      • operations

        public java.lang.String operations(java.lang.String operator,
                                   java.lang.String b,
                                   java.lang.String a)
        Calls parseDouble to convert input strings a and b to double. Then calls the appropriate operation to be carried out on x and y based on the input operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - - mathematical operator
        b - - input string to be converted and evaluated
        a - - input string to be converted and evaluated
        Returns:
        - the result of the chosen mathematical operation, after converting back into a string.

      • multiply

        public java.lang.Double multiply(java.lang.Double x,
                                 java.lang.Double y)
        Multiply two Double values.
        Parameters:
        x - - first factor to be multiplied by second factor
        y - - second factor
        Returns:
        - product of multiplying x by y

      • divide

        public java.lang.Double divide(java.lang.Double x,
                               java.lang.Double y)
                        throws Calculator.DivideByZeroException
        Divide two Double values.
        Parameters:
        x - - dividend
        y - - divisor
        Returns:
        - quotient of x / y
        Throws:
        Calculator.DivideByZeroException

      • mod

        public java.lang.Double mod(java.lang.Double x,
                            java.lang.Double y)
        Modulo operation. Calculates the remainder of the division of x / y.
        Parameters:
        x - - dividend
        y - - divisor
        Returns:
        - remainder of x / y

      • addition

        public java.lang.Double addition(java.lang.Double x,
                                 java.lang.Double y)
        Add two numbers together.
        Parameters:
        x - - addend x
        y - - addend y
        Returns:
        - sum of x + y

      • subtraction

        public java.lang.Double subtraction(java.lang.Double x,
                                    java.lang.Double y)
        Subtract one number from another.
        Parameters:
        x - - minuend
        y - - subtrahend
        Returns:
        - difference of x - y

      • power

        public java.lang.Double power(java.lang.Double x,
                              java.lang.Double y)
        Calculate a number to the power of another number.
        Parameters:
        x - - base
        y - - exponent
        Returns:
        - result of x^y

      • memoryClear

        private void memoryClear()
        Clear Memory function. Clears the value stored in memoryStore.

      • memoryRecall

        private void memoryRecall()
        Memory Recall function. The user can use this function to recall a value previously stored with the Memory Store function and use that value as an operand.

      • memoryStoreFunction

        private void memoryStoreFunction()
        Memory Store function. The user can use this function to store a value for later use.

      • memoryPlus

        private void memoryPlus()
        Memory Plus function. Adds the value input on screen to the current value stored in memoryStore.

      • memoryMinus

        private void memoryMinus()
        Memory Minus function. Subtracts the value input on screen from the current value stored in memoryStore.

      • preventOperatorsInSeries

        private boolean preventOperatorsInSeries()
        Determines whether it is legal to input another operator. This prevents the user from entering three + operators in a row, for example.
        Returns:
        - true if it last input is not an operator or not zero. False otherwise.

      • resetDecimalCheck

        private void resetDecimalCheck()
        Resets the decimal check used to prevent the user from entering multiple decimal points into a single operand.

      • completeDecimal

        public void completeDecimal()
        Checks if the user input a number followed by a decimal point but did not input any digit after the point, and proceeded to press a function button. Adds a 0 after the decimal in this case.

      • getLastChar

        public java.lang.String getLastChar()
        Get the last character on textLine2.
        Returns:
        a substring of textLine2 with the last char trimmed off

      • getLastInfixEnqueued

        public java.lang.String getLastInfixEnqueued()
        Get and return the last element enqueued in the infix queue.
        Returns:
        - value stored at front of infix queue, or empty string

      • lastInputIsOperator

        public boolean lastInputIsOperator()
        Test if the last element enqueued on the infix queue is a supported operator.
        Returns:
        - true if supported operator, false otherwise

      • parenthesisBalanced

        public boolean parenthesisBalanced(java.lang.String par)
        Check if parenthesis entered so far are balanced. Used to decide if it is legal to input a right parenthesis.
        Parameters:
        par - - left parenthesis or right parenthesis
        Returns:
        - true if parenthesis so far are balanced, false otherwise

      • parseDouble

        public double parseDouble(java.lang.String s)
        Attempt to parse a string as a Double.
        Parameters:
        s - - string to be parsed
        Returns:
        - Double value after parsing

      • precedenceLevel

        public int precedenceLevel(java.lang.String operator)
        Classifies the precedence level of the supported operators. This is used in the evaluation of the postfix expression.
        Parameters:
        operator - - operator to check precedence level of
        Returns:
        - precedence level of supplied operator

      • isOperator

        public boolean isOperator(java.lang.String s)
        Check if inputted string is a supported operator.
        Parameters:
        s - - string to be checked
        Returns:
        - true if s is a supported operator, false otherwise

      • isNumber

        public boolean isNumber(java.lang.String s)
        Check if given string can be parsed as a Double, and thus is a number.
        Parameters:
        s - - string to be checked
        Returns:
        - true if string can be parsed, and thus is a number. False otherwise
